page.title: 18ECOLOGY WATER SUPPLY
page.content: Wessex Water has been supplying East and West Grimstead with water since Wessex Water Authority was formed in 1974.Before water was supplied by South Wilts Water Board.The water comes from West Hampshire water company's source at Hale and is supplied by their reservoir at Standlynch near Pepperbox.A few farms in the area have their own private source of supply.Wessex covers 4,000 square miles and includes the counties of Avon,Dorset,Somerset,most of Wiltshire and parts of Gloucestershire and Hampshire.One person drinks in one day 150 litres.The water in our area is sterilised by chlorination.No flouride is at present added to this,or any other supply within the Wessex Water Authority area.
